inclusion.criterion: histologically confirmed diagnosis of WHO grade IV primary malignant glioma (glioblastoma multiforme or gliosarcoma)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: unilateral, single focus of measurable central nervous system (CNS) neoplasm on contrast-enhanced MRI
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: interval of at least 4 weeks from the end of prior radiotherapy or one week from the end of a cycle of chemotherapy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin > or = 9.0 g/dl, absolute neutrophil count (ANC) > or = 1,500 cells/microliters, platelets > or = 125,000 cells/microliters
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Serum creatinine < or = 1.5 mg/dl, serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase (SGOT) and bilirubin < or = 1.5 times upper limit of normal
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients on corticosteroids must have been on a stable dose for 1 week prior to entry, if clinically possible
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Signed informed consent approved by the Institutional Review Board
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No evidence of CNS hemorrhage on the baseline MRI or CT scans
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If sexually active, patients will take contraceptive measures for the duration of treatment as stated in the informed consent
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy or breast feeding. Women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test within 72 hours prior to treatment administration
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Prior treatment with CPT-11 or Avastin
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Co-medication that may interfere with study results; e.g. immuno-suppressive agents other than corticosteroids
exclusion.label: met

notes: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma and is currently on corticosteroids. However, they have not been on a stable dose for 1 week prior to entry.
